org.jfree.data.pie

Interface PieDatasetSelectionState

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DatasetSelectionState
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultKeyedValuesDataset, DefaultPieDataset, JDBCPieDataset

    public interface PieDatasetSelectionState
extends DatasetSelectionState
    Returns information about the selection state of items in an PieDataset. Classes that implement this interface must also implement PublicCloneable to ensure that charts and datasets can be correctly cloned. Likewise, classes implementing this interface must also implement Serializable.

    The selection state might be part of a dataset implementation, or it could be maintained in parallel with a dataset implementation that doesn't directly support selection state.
    Since:
    1.2.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearSelection()
      Clears all selected items.
      void fireSelectionEvent()
      Send an event to registered listeners to indicate that the selection has changed.
      int getItemCount()
      Returns the number of items in the dataset.
      boolean isSelected(java.lang.Comparable key)
      Returns true if the specified item is selected, and false otherwise.
      void setSelected(java.lang.Comparable key, boolean selected)
      Sets the selection state for an item in the dataset.
      void setSelected(java.lang.Comparable key, boolean selected, boolean notify)
      Sets the selection state for the specified item and, if requested, fires a change event.
